page.title: 10COUNTESTHORPE'S OLDEST HOUSE
page.content: This half-timbered,cruck-built house which was built between 1480 and 1520 is known as the oldest house in Countesthorpe. It is at present owned by Dr Hoffler. This house has been used for several different things. It was originally a farmhouse and since then has been a Post Office, a Butcher's and in 1930 it became a Doctor's surgery. It is now purely used as a home. It has six bedrooms, although one of them was originally a cheese room. Also there are two staircases and five rooms downstairs including a kitchen. The house is opposite St Andrews church in the centre of the village. This house is very much part of Countesthorpe.
